ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot of general language skills for speaking, writing and reading Chinese as well as strengthened my ability to produce my own thoughts.
Much better speaking and conversation skills
Further developed grammar and vocabulary, as well as speaking and listening skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Overall this course is very good for quickly developing language skills. It's a lot of work, but it's worth it.

It is hard to stay 100% engaged with a course that meets every day and has homework every day but not in consistent amounts - some days the homework was very light and on other days it would take me hours. This course could be improved so much by going back to the basics of Chinese - e.g teaching us more verbs rather than niche vocabulary - and practising how to ask and respond to questions for the sake of understanding question structure, rather than understanding meaning and giving a high-level response. Maybe a weekly verb vocab list with a short test would be useful. This course could also do a better job of teaching students how to break down a sentence in a reading comprehension and understand its meaning. Even if I understand all the chinese words in a sentence sometimes the meaning of the sentence is still not obvious to me. 

Also, most of the canvas homework quizzes / reading comprehension quizzes use SO much new or niche vocabulary that it is impossible to guess the meaning of the characters from context alone. I think generally the homework is too hard. It would be better if the homework lined up more accurately with what was learnt in class that day and was used just to consolidate knowledge rather than making us guess at unfamiliar vocab.
strengths: many assignments so grades can get higher weaknesses: teacher

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would only recommend it to students dedicated to learning the language
